burlap.domain.singleagent.frostbite

Class FrostbiteDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.domain.singleagent.frostbite.FrostbiteDomain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainGenerator

    public class FrostbiteDomain
extends java.lang.Object
implements DomainGenerator
    A simplified version of the classic Atari Frostbite domain. In this game, the agent must jump between different ice blocks. Each time the agent jumps on an ice block, it adds a layer to an igloo that is being built and "activates" all ice blocks on the same row. Jumping on an activated ice block does not ad a layer to the igloo. Once all rows of ice blocks are activated, they reset and can be activated by jumping on them again. Once the igloo is built, the agent can go to it to win the game. If the agent jumps or walks into the water, the game is over.

    If you run the main method of this class, it will launch of a visual explorer that you can play. They keys w,s,a,d,x correspond to the actions jump north, jump south, move west, move east, do nothing. If you win or lose the visual explorer will automatically terminate. If you want it to keep running, you can set this class' public static visualizingDomain data member to false.
    Author:
    Phillipe Morere

      • buildingStepsToWin

        protected int buildingStepsToWin

      • transitionDynamics

        protected double[][] transitionDynamics
        Matrix specifying the transition dynamics in terms of movement directions. The first index indicates the action direction attempted (ordered north, south, east, west) the second index indicates the actual resulting direction the agent will go (assuming there is no wall in the way). The value is the probability of that outcome. The existence of walls does not affect the probability of the direction the agent will actually go, but if a wall is in the way, it will affect the outcome. For instance, if the agent selects north, but there is a 0.2 probability of actually going east and there is a wall to the east, then with 0.2 probability, the agent will stay in place.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function to test the domain. Note: The termination conditions are not checked when testing the domain this way, which means it is impossible to win or die and might trigger bugs. To enable them, uncomment the code in the "update" function.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • getCleanState

        public static State getCleanState(Domain domain)
        Creates a state with one agent, one igloo, and 4 rows of 4 platforms. The object values are uninitialised and will have to be set manually or with methods like setAgent(burlap.oomdp.core.states.State, int, int).

      • movementDirectionFromIndex

        protected int[] movementDirectionFromIndex(int i)
        Returns the change in x and y position for a given direction number.
        Parameters:
        i - the direction number (0,1,2,3 indicates north,south,east,west, respectively)
        Returns:
        the change in direction for x and y; the first index of the returned double is change in x, the second index is change in y.
